main event: A pilot and co-pilot on an aircraft observed unusual lights and conditions while flying over Larson AFB, Washington on March 31, 1965.
interesting points: The co-pilot thought the pilot had turned on the landing lights, but this was not the case.
The illumination seemed to surround the entire aircraft, like it was in a 'light seam', but it was not bright enough to cause blindness.
The unusual lighting and conditions only lasted for about 15 seconds, and the rest of the flight was normal.
No actual object was sighted, just the unusual lighting effects.
Weather conditions were obscured or hazy, with visibility around 2-3 miles.
sighted object: unusual lighting effects surrounding the aircraft
witnesses: pilot and co-pilot of an aircraft
